alert.note: Alert for Kent; New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 15 at 1:47PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Delaware...and northern Delaware... including the following counties...in central Delaware...Kent. In northern Delaware...New Castle. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 147 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Newark, Middletown, Smyrna, Clayton, Delaware City, Cheswold, Mount Pleasant, Saint Georges, Green Spring, Delaney Corner, Bear, and Glasgow. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 0 and 9. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
